messageBody:
Curt Sampson wrote:
> On Wed, 21 Jul 2004, J. B. Rainsberger wrote:
>
> > For testing with a database, I recommend recreate test data for each
> > test case. Recreating the database is only one way to achieve this.
>
> Typically what I do for unit testing database code is to load up a
> particular, "static" set of test data, and have each test start a
> transaction in the setup, and roll back the transaction in the teardown.
> That ensures that the database itself never changes, and yet tests can
> make any changes that they want, confident that they will all go away
> when done.

I have tried this, and it works quite well. As long as committing
transactions isn't part of the test case itself, it's a good technique.

Still, the ultimate solution is to reduce the number of tests against
the database. :) (_JUnit Recipes_, chapter 10.)
